fullProgramDescription: The Applied Mathematics major at UC Berkeley is designed to provide students with a broad foundation in mathematical techniques and their applications in various fields. The program includes a core sequence of lower-division mathematics courses, upper-division mathematics courses that emphasize applications, and electives in mathematics and related fields. The major prepares students for careers in fields that rely heavily on mathematical modeling and problem-solving.
shortProgramDescription: The Applied Mathematics B.S. provides a broad foundation in mathematical techniques and their applications, preparing students for diverse careers or further study.
classHighlights: The lower-division core includes Calculus (Math 1A, 1B, 1C), Linear Algebra (Math 54), and Differential Equations (Math 54 or Math 128A), providing a foundation in mathematical analysis and problem-solving.

Upper-division requirements include courses in Applied Mathematics (Math 106), Partial Differential Equations (Math 126 or 128B), and Numerical Analysis (Math 128A), along with electives in areas such as mathematical modeling, computational mathematics, and mathematical physics.

Students also complete a sequence of upper-division mathematics courses that emphasize applications, such as Mathematical Methods for the Physical Sciences (Math 106) and Partial Differential Equations (Math 126).
Electives allow students to explore areas such as mathematical biology, mathematical finance, and computational science, providing a broad understanding of the applications of mathematics.
The major requires a total of 12 upper-division mathematics courses, ensuring a deep understanding of mathematical techniques and their applications.
learningOutcomes: Apply mathematical techniques to model and solve problems in various fields.
Understand the theoretical foundations of mathematical analysis and linear algebra.
Analyze and solve problems using differential equations and numerical methods.
Communicate complex mathematical ideas and results effectively.
Use mathematical software and computational tools to analyze and solve problems.
Recognize the importance of mathematical modeling in science and engineering.
creditRequirements: 120 semester credits (total), with at least 36 upper-division credits in mathematics
additionalInformation: The Applied Mathematics major requires a strong foundation in lower-division mathematics courses. Upper-division courses emphasize applications and provide a broad understanding of mathematical techniques. Students are encouraged to explore electives in related fields such as physics, computer science, and engineering.
